other_tests.findings: Evidence of septal mid-wall late gadolinium enhancement compatible with the septal perforation and a chronic inferior wall subendocardial infarct.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up CMR scan performed 8 weeks after PCI showed a small area of focal fibrosis in the mid septum at the site of previous intervention, which is less prominent than seen on the previous scan, likely representing infarct resorption and a reduction in associated inflammatory changes.

other_tests.findings: A very small focus of residual fibrosis in the mid septum at the site of previous intervention; signal due to the known inferior subendocardial infarct.
The baseline and post-procedure ECGs did not show any significant differences.
No inducible ischemia on the stress perfusion scan images.
